Operations on graphs

Source: R/classifications.R
graph-operations.Rd

Orphanet classification system can be depicted by oriented graphs as it is a wide list of parent/child relationships.

The igraph package provides useful tools for graphs analysis that we can use for the study of rare diseases.

The roots are the ORPHAcodes without any parent, like the heads of classification. The leaves are the ORPHAcodes without any children. They are usually disorders or subtypes of disorders (see get_classification_level()).

Usage

find_roots(graph)

find_leaves(graph)

Arguments

graph

An igraph object.

Value

The extrem nodes of a graph.

Examples

graph = get_ancestors('303', output='graph')

roots = find_roots(graph)
leaves = find_leaves(graph)
